1668-d-09-19-94-MNL.Narrative: MXL-2, AN EASTBOUND LOADED COAL TRAIN MOVING FROM BROOKVILLE TO DRIFTWOOD, PA WAS APPROACHING AN INTERLOCKED RR CROSSING AT GRADE WITH THE BUFFALO AND PITTSBURGH RR IN FALLS CREEK, PA WHEN IT ENCOUNTERED A MAINLINE FACING POINT SWITCH LINED FOR MOVEMENT FROM THE MAINLINE ONTO FALLS CREEK SIDING NO.ONE. IN PREPARATION FOR CROSSING THE DIAMOND AT THE MAXIMUM 10 MPH, THE ENGINEER HAD MADE A MINIMUMTRAIN BRAKE APPLICATION AND GRADUALLY REDUCED THE THROTTLE FROM POSITION 8 TO POSITION 2, RESULTINGIN A TRAIN SPEED REDUCTION FROM 22 MPH TO 19 MPH. THE TRAIN DIVERTED FROM THE MAIN TRACK TO FALLS CREEK SIDING AT A SWITCH SIX-TENTHS OF A MILE WEST OF THE DIAMOND CROSSING AT 19 MPH. AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION WAS MADE AS THE TRAIN DIVERTED ONTO THE SIDING. THE TRAIN COLLIDED WITH NINE CARS LOCATED ON THE SIDING AND CAME TO REST AFTER TRAVELING 382 FT BEYOND THE MAINLINE SWITCH. UPON INVESTIGATION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LOCK ON THE MAINLINE SWITCH AND THE SWITCH HANDLE WAS DOGGED IN THE REVERSE POSITION. VANDALS RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS ACCIDENT HAVE NOT YET BEEN IDENTIFIED.NoneNoneNoneNone
